Timeline:
INC0082529 . Work notes

01/26/2024 19:33:06(US/Eastern) . Joshua Trouten

Title: Some users may experience multiple issues with their Microsoft Teams

User impact: Users may experience multiple issues with their Microsoft Teams.

More info: Affected scenarios include, but aren't limited to the following:

Mitigated/improving:

- [Updated] Users logging in or unlocking their devices after some time may have missing messages. We believe that this symptom has been addressed.
- [Updated] Users may have been unable to load messages in channels and chats. We believe that this symptom has been addressed.
- [Updated] Users were unable to view or download their media (images, videos, audio, call recordings, code snippets). We believe that this symptom has been addressed.
- [Updated] Some users were experiencing delays sending and receiving chat messages. We believe this symptom has been largely addressed, though some users may still experience brief delays.
- [Updated] Anonymous users may be unable to join meetings. We’re seeing improvement in this area but some users may still be affected by this scenario.
- [Updated] Teams connectors for Power Automate/Power Apps were experiencing errors. We believe that this symptom has been addressed.
- [Updated] Call Recordings might take longer to appear in user's OneDrive for Business and SharePoint Online. This symptom has been addressed.

Still affected/undergoing further evaluation:

- Users may be unable to load previous Copilot history, or new history is not written
- Bots may be unable to download attachments
- Sending and receiving read receipt notifications may be delayed
- Users may experience issues resuming or rejoining meetings.
- Users within organizations leveraging an Information Barrier may experience issues joining meetings
- Users performing a cold boot may not be able to log into teams and will see an "oops" page

Current status: We’re seeing significant improvements with many of the Teams features affected by this incident as we continue to apply mitigations and optimize traffic. We’re evaluating the remaining impact scenarios and are developing fixes and workstreams to address all lingering impact associated with this event. Please see the “more info” section above for the latest information on each impact scenario.

We understand the impact an issue like this can have on your organization, and we appreciate your partnership and patience as we work to remediate this issue.

Scope of impact: This issue can potentially impact any Microsoft Teams user in the scenarios outlined in the More info section.

Start time: Friday, January 26, 2024 at 9:55 AM EST
.

Next update by: Friday, January 26, 2024 at 9:30 PM EST

01/26/2024 18:03:21 EST - Joshua Trouten Work notes
5:58pm ET Microsoft Update:
We’re continuing to apply mitigations across the affected infrastructure and our telemetry is showing additional improvement in the user experience, though many customers are still affected by this issue. 01/26/2024 17:15:22 EST - Joshua Trouten Work notes
5:02p ET Microsoft Update:
Current status: Our network and backend service optimization efforts are ongoing and we’re monitoring internal telemetry to confirm that our efforts are effectively reducing the impact to customers. We’re continuing to scale up our services and identify new workstreams intended to remediate this problem more rapidly. Although many customers remain impacted by this issue, we’re seeing a reduction in errors and an increase in availability.

01/26/2024 16:34:14 EST - Joshua Trouten Work notes
4:26p ET Microsoft Update:
As we have scaled out our services we've hit performance issues with some downstream components. The previously mentioned throttling within internal systems is not the result of excessive load across our hosting capacity. As we’ve scaled up to accommodate traffic increases, some backend services unexpectedly sent excessive requests to internal
authentication components, resulting in throttling to preserve the health of those components.

Business Impact: - Users performing a cold boot may not able to log into teams and will see an "oops" page
- Users logging in or unlocking their devices after some time may see missing messages
- Users may fail to load messages in channels and chats
- Users are unable to view or download their media (images, videos, audio, call recordings, code snippets)
- Some messages may experience delays being sent
- Call Recordings might take longer to appear in user's OneDrive for Business and SharePoint Online
- Users may be unable to load previous Copilot history, or new history is not written
- Bots may be unable to download attachments
- Sending and receiving read receipt notifications may be delayed

Restoration Manager: Joshua Trouten

Major Incident Manager: Kimberly Tischler Lenk

Some users may experience multiple issues with their Microsoft Teams

- Users performing a cold boot may not able to log into teams and will see an "oops" page

03/04/2024 11:55:14(US/Eastern) . Kimberly Tischler Lenk

This issue affects users who need to access network elements on Lumen through the workspace.
This requires the 4.12 version of Citrix.
If users don't need to access Lumen elements, they can upgrade to 22.10.0.21.

 

INC0085661 . Work notes

03/04/2024 11:50:42(US/Eastern) . Kimberly Tischler Lenk

There is a workaround for this:
Users will need to run their brightspeed Chrome and their Brightspeed applications out of Citrix via the browser (lite version).
A reboot is also required.

Per Bill Middleton: immediately after restarting it was working and then within just a few minutes it went back into a state where we couldn't connect to the database.
Connection pooling and the error we're getting is connection is not available.
Yet when viewing the process list, to not see any queries running and other services seem to be able to connect to the database OK.
So it seems it seems to be limited to just Job InfoManager service.
Team hasn't pushed code to the service since February 26th.
And do not believe we made any database changes with changes Friday night that would affect this.

INC0086330 . Work notes

03/09/2024 09:59:35(US/Eastern) . Kathryn Raskob

Summary of troubleshooting (Priya Nivarthi)
As part of the change request event that started last night, there were two things taking place:
-multiple applications that were connected to Oracle metal servers, DB servers, the one that was primary was swapped with the HA DB server so that today a firmware upgrade on the primary could take place.
-once the firm ware upgrade completed tonight, the team would swap back to primary.
*
As part of the swap last night when we swapped the primary and HA, it seems like the primary DB server was not brought down.
So somewhere in the application it was still trying to connect to the primary even though it was swapped out.
Infrastructure team (Satish) completely shut down the primary that was taken out, that was swapped out last night.
Now the application is forced to connect to the HDB server and it is working fine.

03/09/2024 08:50:54 EST - Kathryn Raskob Work notes
Per Priyma: To summarize the issue, there was change activity CHG0038568 performed last evening (BMS Firmware upgrade TS24.02 to version TS54.01). Part of this change was a database switchover and the application was pointed to a high availability database.
Since then, the application has not been fully usable.
We are not seeing the information that we would normally see when somebody logs into the application, such as UNIQUAL layers and be able to search for an address and all that kind of thing.
*
Requesting to page Infrastructure to the bridge.

Business Impact:Uniqual layers not showing up. Unable to search

Restoration Manager:

Major Incident Manager: Kathryn Raskob

Brightspeed Incident: INC0086330

Lumen Incident:

Ref:MSG3119216_XAUPyLKfJn0QC1rkkFvD

INC0094972 . Work notes

12:17PM EST cache was refreshed (per Jitender)
12:53PM EST Teams agree that issue appears to be resolved; awaiting confirmation from Technicians.

INC0094972 . Work notes

Clearing cache at 12:18 PM EST may have fixed the issue.

INC0094972 . Work notes

05/20/2024 12:32:22(US/Eastern) . Kathryn Raskob

Brightspeed Team asking Straviso if there there are any alarm or anything set up for those cache issues
Straviso to make sure that we had an alarm set up that if we don't return the API, are they URL in cache to generate alerts.

 

INC0094972 . Work notes

05/20/2024 12:30:33(US/Eastern) . Kathryn Raskob

Report from Brian McCarthy, Straviso:
Found a potential issue with the cache on one of the 8 pods.
When we would go to cache to try and get the API endpoint URL, it wasn't retrieving anything and it was sending those jobs into archive.
Refreshed cache about 5 minutes ago and are monitoring for any more recurrences.
Requesting Brightspeed Support team to validate any new occurrences.

 

INC0094972 . Work notes

05/20/2024 12:00:15(US/Eastern) . Kathryn Raskob

Brightspeed Support Team has identified, and Straviso also figured out whenever we are doing bulk status update, the first job of that status update is fine and it is staying as accepted, but all other subsequent jobs which were there as part of that list, those are getting archived.

 

INC0094972 . Work notes

05/20/2024 11:46:27(US/Eastern) . Kathryn Raskob

Summary:
116 jobs have been sync'd that were the result of this issue with archiving - giving the Techs the jobs to continue working.
Straviso continues to look for root cause on another bridge.
Anuj Patait confirmed there were no planned changes over the weekend to infrastructure/application.
Straviso reporting they have not changed anything as well.
Support team have fixed what they saw being archived which were not supposed to be archived.
Issue only happening when technicians are doing bulk update, so if they will do individual updates on the job, they should work fine

INC0096012 . Work notes

05/29/2024 08:57:24(US/Eastern) . Kathryn Raskob

Below is the flow for these proxy

End User (UI page) ➟ Global Load Balancer (GLB) + Cloud Armor ➟ Internet Network Endpoint Group (NEG -backend)➟ Apigee Front-End ➟ Network Load Balancer (NLB) ➟ API Service ➟ API Pods

Internet Network Endpoint Group (NEG -backend) ---> dio-api-prd.brightspeed.com

Apigee Front-End --> dio-apg-prd-fe.brightspeed.com

Network Load Balancer (NLB) --> dio-api-prd-backend.brightspeed.com

When we hit shop.brightspeed.com then this will invoke --> End User (UI page) ➟ Global Load Balancer (GLB) + Cloud Armor

From UI when you hit the API then this will invoke --> End User (UI page) ➟ Global Load Balancer (GLB) + Cloud Armor ➟ Internet Network Endpoint Group (NEG -backend)

INC0099231 . Work notes

06/21/2024 08:39:45(US/Eastern) . Glen Schultz

AM update from MS - Service: Virtual Machines
Region: East US
Impact Statement: Starting at 22:35 UTC on 19 Jun to 16:30 UTC on 20 Jun 2024, customers using Virtual Machines / Virtual Machines Scale Sets in East US who may have received error notifications when performing service management operations - such as create, delete, update, scaling, start, stop - for resources hosted in this region.
The failures have subsided and customers should not be experiencing any more allocation failures. However, we are aware of capacity constraints in East US Zone 2 (Az2) affecting Intel and AMD general-purpose VM sizes, this issue was exacerbated by an issue that was impacting our allocator service. This issue has been mitigated, however we acknowledge that it is possible for customers to observe provisioning errors with the following SKUs. Dasv5, Dadsv5, DDSv5, Dasv4, Dsv5, DDsv5, LSv3, Easv5, Dsv4, Easv4, BS, Dsv4, Dv2, Av2, Eadsv5, Esv5.
Customer workaround
While constraints are impacting the region, we know that AZ2 is more constrained than other availability zones in the region. As a result, customers are advised to move VMs to either AZ1 or AZ3. If services across three availability zones are necessary, deploying resources to East US 2 is also an option for customers.
Please refer to this documentation to understand the logical to physical availability zone mapping for your subscription: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/resources/subscriptions/list-locations?view=rest-resources-2022-12-01&tabs=HTTP
Current workstreams
· We are undergoing efforts to reclaim capacity in Zone 2, with immediate consumption of reclaimed resources.
· We are restoring capacity by bringing in some of our offline nodes back to production.
· We are evicting internal non-production workloads to alleviate pressure and release capacity.
· We expect that new capacity will be brought online by the end of July 2024.
· The next update for this event will be on the 7 of July with a status update.

INC0099231 . Work notes

06/20/2024 11:14:53(US/Eastern) . Glen Schultz

From Everett : Bringing IT Leadership upto speed on the Virtual Desktop Issues affecting your Dev Teams. T
here is a regional outage in Azure East where all of our Citrix Virtual Desktops live. There is no ETR for this outage from Microsoft. As the largest and most critical Business User of Citrix we have moved the Call Centers to Azure West and they are operating out of that datacenter. The primary remaining impact is to privileged IT Desktops. The IT Desktops cannot be moved because they are persistent and it would take many weeks to build out and migrate the desktops. We are in a DR situation at this point and are reliant on Microsoft to get the VDI Resources back online. We have SevA case open with them, we have escalated, and they cannot give us an ETR. Some work arounds to consider is using BeyondTrust to access the day1 Jump Boxes. Dev's sign into their desktop early AM when VDI resources are available, and keep them active during the day. Do not logout or reboot your desktop, because it is not guaranteed to be able to restart. Here is a screenshot of the service health bulletin from Microsoft for awareness. We expect Microsoft to fix this issue quickly as it is impacting all customers in Azure East US. I know we are all under major time pressures to deliver, and I really appreciate you and your teams patience while we work through this situation

Short Description : Restored email
Incident Communication Plan : ICP0001666
Incident Communication Task : ICT0001902
Email Subject : RESTORED: Service Disruption Event - INC0104424 - Calix Cloud
Email Body : Major Incident Executive Summary (Restored)

Calix Cloud

Description: All Network elements lost connectivity to Calix Cloud

Start Time: 07/20/2024 11:24:04 EDT

End Time:

Resolution:

Current Summary:

07/20/2024 16:08:01 EDT - Erin Kuester Additional comments
Connectivity to Calix Cloud have been re-established, found potential asymmetrical routing issue and Brightspeed Infrastructure team removed routes from Google Central region which re-established communication. Team is proceeding with an emergency change to record this change.

07/20/2024 14:39:45 EDT - Erin Kuester Additional comments
During new customer installs the field techs are not able to associate the customer successfully which may prevent them from getting the correct speed profile. There is no impact to existing customers.

07/20/2024 14:21:34 EDT - Erin Kuester Additional comments
Customer impact at this time: Unable to pull any stats from calix cloud, This will cause new customer associations in cloud to fail. ONT stats are unable to be retrieved. Speedtests do work but only if RG(residential gateway) to customer association is made so existing customers should be ok its new installs and Health Certificates that would be issue.

Business Impact: All CPE Communication lost to Calix Cloud

Line(s) of Business Impacted: NextGen Networks

Workaround: N/A

Restoration Manager: Hermie Cloete

Major Incident Manager: Erin Kuester

Brightspeed Incident: INC0104424

Brightspeed Problem: N/A

Lumen Incident: N/A

Ref:MSG4071991_XPoKKQTD9eunRaM74BCe

Short Description : Update Email

Email Subject : UPDATE:Outage - INC0104891-Axon Orchestrator or MAESTRO
Email Body : Major Incident Executive Summary (Update)

Axon Orchestrator or MAESTRO

Description: Axon Orchestrator (AO) Issues

Business Impact:Devices are not showing up in AO - new orders are not completing - AO->BOSS notification is not generating.

Line(s) of Business Impacted: Architecture & Technology, Field Operations, Operations Support

Workaround: For 4GLTE installs, Field Techs must manually enter the SIP creds for new orders

# of Users Impacted: 115-120 orders

Severity: 2 - High

Start Time: 07/22/2024 11:26:13 EDT

Current Summary:

07/26/2024 14:37:11 EDT - Kathryn Raskob Additional comments
Summary on issues addressed in this major incident:
AXE-115: BOSS OM no longer receives Provisioning notification from AO PROD – AXON and BOSS-OM found a change was needed to address an AO 6.1.22 requirement for the websocket subscription for ‘query’ parameter. This was a change since AO 5.4.5. After updates in BOSS-OM DEV environment the connections are now working and have been monitored with plans to deploy changes to PROD the night of Friday, July 26th @21:00 ET (CHG0041055). Once deployed to PROD the workaround for 4GLTE installs will no longer be needed and Brightspeed Field Techs will no longer manually enter SIP credentials for new orders. AXON will provide root cause analysis (RCA). Brightspeed RCA will be documented in problem record PRB0040732.

AXE-121: Devices/ CPE are not informing to AO – SIM registration to Waverly failed due to wrong URL. AXON implemented a work around to correct the eSIM service database registration for all affected devices and triggered a database re-sync so that they will get subscribed. Previously impacted devices are active in AO. AXON continues to investigate root cause for the eSIM registration errors and have engaged Greenwave to assist. Gimbert Richiez has requested the JIRA ticket AXE-121 remain open until the root cause analysis (RCA) is received from AXON. AXON RCA to include the cause for Axon vedge-device service requiring to be restarted – as the AXON observability dashboard reported service as working properly. Brightspeed RCA will be documented in problem record PRB0040726.

Next planned update status will be 10:00 ET, Monday July 29th.

07/25/2024 19:22:07 EDT - Kathryn Raskob Additional comments
BOSS-OM Update from Sambaath Chennai Somasundaram Thursday, July 25, 2024 5:59 PM ET:
BOSS OM – AXON connections are working now in Dev environment. Updates will be deployed to production on the night of 07/26/2024.

07/25/2024 10:50:12 EDT - Kathryn Raskob Additional comments
AXON providing Brightspeed a container that will include additional debug capabilities that DevOps will deploy into DEV.
Once deployed AXON will be able to capture additional information they need and evaluate during their work hours (Singapore).
Infrastructure has enabled the AXON team to operate independently within our development environments during their working hours, which aids in enhancing overall efficiency.
Teams will reconvene on same AXON bridge tomorrow at 08:00A ET to review further debugging results.
AXON's JIRA ticket remains at a High Priority level.
Next planned update status will be 09:00AM ET, tomorrow July 26th
No resolution ETA at this time.

INC0106317 . Work notes

07/30/2024 16:19:54(US/Eastern) . Glen Schultz

There has been an update on the revocation timing update. Please see the below:
DigiCert have been actively engaged with the CA/Browser Forum (CABF) and the customers impacted by this incident. Many of these customers have been able to reissue their certificates. Unfortunately, several other customers operating critical infrastructure, vital telecommunications networks, cloud services, and healthcare industries are not in a position to have all their certificates reissued and deployed in time, without critical service interruptions.
To avoid disruption to critical services, we have engaged with members of the browser community alongside our customers over the last several hours. Based on these discussions, we are now in a position to postpone revocation by an additional 96 hours, where required.
All impacted certificates will now be revoked no later than Saturday, August 3rd, 2024, 19:30 UTC. DigiCert will follow the standard CABF process for delayed revocations. All impacted customers will be notified by email in the next few hours.

CrowdStrike

Description: CrowdStrike: Windows crashes (Blue Screen of Death) related to Falcon Sensor | 2024-07-19

Line(s) of Business Impacted: Company Wide

Workaround: Workaround provided by CrowdStrike:
Boot Windows into Safe Mode or the Windows Recovery Environment
Navigate to the C:\Windows\System32\drivers\CrowdStrike directory
Locate the file matching "C-00000291*.sys", and delete it.
Boot the host normally.

# of Users Impacted: 50+

Severity: 2 - High

Start Time: 07/19/2024 02:30:40 EDT

Current Summary:

07/19/2024 18:05:54 EDT - Everett Stevenson Additional comments
The Brightspeed Infrastructure Team has restored all critical Windows servers in production.

All Critical Business apps are remediated.

Users still experiencing Lumen desktop issues can call the Brightspeed Service Desk for assistance. If the issue is not resolved, BRSPD SD will create a ticket with Lumen on behalf of the user. Lumen will be working through the weekend to contact users and address users. Service desk hours are 5:00AM to 9PM EST Mon-Sun. 1.833.965.1633.

Brightspeed Infrastructure Team will monitor through the weekend and by on standby to respond if any issue is identified.

Confirmation of system status will be sent on Monday, 7/22 at 9:00 AM EST.

07/19/2024 15:24:13 EDT - Glen Schultz Additional comments
The Brightspeed Infrastructure Team continues to restore windows servers impacted by the CrowdStrike outage. All Business Critical production apps have been remediated and BIDE is being worked on. The team is working to restore the remainder of PROD apps (mainly internal tools used by the Infrastructure team). Once they are done with production, they will move on to lower environments.

The Brightspeed IT Service Desk has received 219 calls mostly for PC issues. Lumen PC issues require assistance from the Lumen Service Desk at 1-877-828-4357.

Most users with Brightspeed devices have been able to self-resolve and for those that can't, we are working thru them 1 by 1. Any users with Blue Screens or needing a recovery key should call into the IT Service Desk.

There is no ETA on final resolution. Next update in 2 hours.

07/19/2024 14:04:26 EDT - Glen Schultz Additional comments
GIS and Vertex are now working.

The Brightspeed IT Service Desk has received 50 calls, but all have been for Lumen Devices, which require assistance from the Lumen Service Desk at 1-877-828-4357.
Most users with Brightspeed devices have been able to self-resolve.
Users have reported issues trying to reach the Lumen Service Desk but are experiencing long hold times.
The Brightspeed Major Incident Team is attempting to contact Lumen to request dedicated support capacity for Brightspeed users.
Customers impacts include being unable to make payments online, in IVR, or with Reps with TSA Applications.
Open Switch Gate, Lumen TSA system, have been reported as unavailable.

07/19/2024 08:13:28 EDT - Kathryn Raskob Additional comments
Crowd Strike Updated Tech Notice:
Tech Alert | Windows crashes related to Falcon Sensor | 2024-07-19
Cloud:
US-1EU-1US-2
Published Date: Jul 19, 2024

Summary
CrowdStrike is aware of reports of crashes on Windows hosts related to the Falcon Sensor.

Details
Symptoms include hosts experiencing a bugcheck\blue screen error related to the Falcon Sensor.
Windows hosts which have not been impacted do not require any action as the problematic channel file has been reverted.
Windows hosts which are brought online after 0527 UTC will also not be impacted
Hosts running Windows7/2008 R2 are not impacted.
This issue is not impacting Mac- or Linux-based hosts
Channel file "C-00000291*.sys" with timestamp of 0527 UTC or later is the reverted (good) version.
Channel file "C-00000291*.sys" with timestamp of 0409 UTC is the problematic version.

Current Action
CrowdStrike Engineering has identified a content deployment related to this issue and reverted those changes.
If hosts are still crashing and unable to stay online to receive the Channel File Changes, the following steps can be used to workaround this issue:
Workaround Steps for individual hosts:
Reboot the host to give it an opportunity to download the reverted channel file. If the host crashes again, then:
Boot Windows into Safe Mode or the Windows Recovery Environment

Note: Putting the host on a wired network (as opposed to WiFi) and using Safe Mode with Networking can help remediation.

Navigate to the %WINDIR%\System32\drivers\CrowdStrike directory
Locate the file matching “C-00000291*.sys”, and delete it.
Boot the host normally.
Note: Bitlocker-encrypted hosts may require a recovery key.

Workaround Steps for public cloud or similar environment including virtual:
Option 1:
Detach the operating system disk volume from the impacted virtual server
Create a snapshot or backup of the disk volume before proceeding further as a precaution against unintended changes
Attach/mount the volume to to a new virtual server
Navigate to the %WINDIR%\\System32\drivers\CrowdStrike directory

INC0111287 . Work notes

08/27/2024 14:09:49(US/Eastern) . Kimberly Tischler Lenk

Last night a change was made to the VPN configuration to the Google environment and Calix Cloud.
The initial round of testing was successful.
The team has determined that there was a changed pushed on the Calix Cloud with improper addresses which caused the event.
A combination of 129 Optical Line Terminal devices (OLT) & Access Service Manager (ASM) were impacted.
Brightspeed NOC team has executed a script to remediate 129 OLT's & ASM's.

ip prefix-list DOMAIN_SERVERS

ip name-server source-interface v4052
no address 10.137.244.132

address 10.137.252.4
address 10.137.254.5
end
copy r s

 

INC0111287 . Work notes

08/27/2024 12:59:49(US/Eastern) . Kimberly Tischler Lenk

Last night a change was made to the VPN configuration to the Google environment and Calix.
The initial round of testing was successful.
The team has determined that there was a change made on the route 53 site, which Calix sits on and it was pushed in error.
The resolver IP's were changed, so the devices (approximately 100) are not able to reach Calix.
Calix is recommending that the devices point to Brightspeed IPs, so changes made by Calix won't affect our application.

Status: Service degradation
Issue type: Incident
Start time: Sep 12, 2024, 8:27 AM EDT

More info
Impacted Microsoft 365 services and applications include, but aren't limited to:
- Microsoft Teams
- Exchange Online
- SharePoint Online

Scope of impact
Impact is specific to a subset of users who are attempting to access the service from the North America region.


Current status
Sep 12, 2024, 9:34 AM EDT

This quick update is designed to give the latest information on this issue.
